email.title: Weekly Digest

image.alt: Stack of biscuits on a plate
image.title: Oddly satisfying

email.text:
Hi everyone!
We hope you enjoyed our Faces of Engineering panel last week, as well as our End of Decade Bar Night and (for postgraduates) the Postgraduate Drinks. Thank you to those of you attending the off-campus events held by our sponsors Liquidnet and Entrepreneur First, we hope you found them useful and fun.
As the Department of Computing goes into December exams (or in the case of second years, their final week of Pintos), the next week will be quieter. Despite the short digest, we have some exciting things to announce, including an open Union debate about the planned halls rent increase. There will also be our annual Christmas party and long-awaited UROP 101 talk, so read on for more information!
email.heading: Halls Rent Debate

event.text:
Have your say over the price of rent in halls.
SIGN UP HERE: https://www.imperialcollegeunion.org/whats-on/event/7503
The College and the Union negotiate over the price of rent in halls periodically, and this year we have a real opportunity to shape what this will look like. We're holding a special meeting of Union Council to decide on the best way to move forward.
The plan is for the President and Deputy President Welfare to present the information they have and invite questions and contributions from the floor, and then for elected student reps from across the College to take a vote on the best way to move forward.
Please join us and make your voice heard!

email.heading: Imperial Careers Service and JobsLive Events
email.text:
Are you an undergraduate still looking for an internship over the summer? Or maybe a graduating student looking for employment? With internship deadlines fast approaching, you're not too late to start applying with the help of Imperial Careers Service!
From CV/cover letter workshops, mock interviews, to Employer Led sessions (past events include events run by Airbus, HSBC, Nestle and KPMG), there is a wealth of events available on JobsLive to help you get started with your internship/job pursuit.
Make sure to follow Careers Service on social media to stay updated with events announcements, as well as different competitions they run (for a chance to win a prize!): [Facebook](https://facebook.com/imperialcollegecareers) [Twitter](https://twitter.com/imperialcareers) [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ic_careers)
email.heading: Conf42 - Chaos Engineering Conference - Special DoCSoc Tickets

event.text: Learn how companies such as Netflix and PagerDuty intentionally break their systems at scale to build more resilient, scalable systems. Conf42 (https://conf42.com) is giving away heavily discounted tickets to DoCSoc members and Imperial College students. Conf42 will take place on 23rd January 2020 at The Comedy Store in Soho, with a day of talks from industry leaders in chaos engineering, followed by networking drinks at The Comedy Pub. The following special tickets are available for all Imperial College students (bring your friends!): all students can purchase a conference ticket for a heavily discounted price of £39 (standard price £339); students from underrepresented groups in technology who are unable to attend without financial assistance can apply for free tickets. (DoCSoc is also able to subsidise the cost of travel for attendees who are eligible for this category.) To obtain a special ticket, email docsoc@imperial.ac.uk.

email.heading: DoCSoc Christmas Party

event.text:
Come put on your Santa hat and Christmas jumper, and join us for a night of festive fun! There'll be mince pies, Christmassy snacks, mulled wine, hot chocolate, and more. We'll also be playing some games, so come get into the holiday spirit with us at the end of a busy term or have one final party before your exams!
_______
You must be a member of DoCSoc on the day of the event in order to attend. Computing, JMC, and EIE students are automatically DoCSoc members. Membership can be purchased for £30 at docsoc.co.uk/join.

email.heading: UROP 101

event.text:
Thinking of how to enjoy your summer and learn new technologies? Then join us at UROP 101 talk where you will get to know all essential information about Undergraduate Research Opportunities Programme. The speaker of the talk will be Paul Kelly who manages the scheme.
_______
You must be a member of DoCSoc on the day of the event in order to attend. Computing, JMC, and EIE students are automatically DoCSoc members. Membership can be purchased for £30 at docsoc.co.uk/join.

email.heading: Future of Blockchain Algorand Workshop

event.text:
Join us for a technical deep-dive into Algorand with one of their core developers.
This is a must-attend event for those building on Algorand in Future of Blockchain or considering doing so!
If you don't know already, Future of Blockchain is a 3 month competition for developers and entrepreneurs to build a project. Late registrations are still open via www.futureofblockchain.co.uk.
We'll be covering: - Technical overview of Algorand - Algorand new features - How to build an app on Algorand - Top tips on how to win a prize on Algorand! - Pizza and beer
Please note it would be helpful to bring a laptop!
There are travel grants of available for those travelling from Cambridge or Oxford! Email Anthony if you need one - anthony@stakezero.com.

email.heading: Citadel & Citadel Securities Internships and Graduate Positions
email.sponsor:
**Citadel** is a leading investor in the world’s financial markets. For over a quarter of a century, we have sought to deliver industry-leading investment returns to clients including corporate pensions, endowments, foundations, public institutions, and sovereign wealth funds.
**Citadel Securities** is an award-winning global market maker that helps meet the liquidity needs of asset managers, banks, broker-dealers, hedge funds, government agencies, and public pension programs.
Applications open for both internships and graduate roles for the following positions: - Investment & Trading - Quantitative Strategies - Software Engineering
Apply via our websites citadel.com & citadelsecurities.com
